meanings.definition: To discipline or punish in order to correct behavior.
meanings.sent1: When my dog misbehaves, I chasten him by using a firm tone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher chastens the students when they talk out of turn.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten learned quickly that being chastened meant no more treats.
meanings.sent4: Life often chastens us through difficult experiences, teaching us valuable lessons.
meanings.sent5: The strict coach chastens the players to improve their performance.

meanings.sent1: She chastens her spending habits to save money for a vacation.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised him to chasten his intake of sugary foods.
meanings.sent3: His love for chocolate had to be chastened to avoid gaining too much weight.
meanings.sent4: The storm chastens the enthusiasm of the beachgoers, forcing them to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: To maintain a healthy lifestyle, it is important to chasten unhealthy habits.
